document.docTitle: Dichromadora sinica Huang & Zhang 2010, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of Dichromadora (Nematoda: Chromadorida: Chromadoridae) from the Yellow Sea, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of Dichromadora (Nematoda: Chromadorida: Chromadoridae) from the Yellow Sea, China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Four males and five females were observed. Holotype : one male , specimen number of new species: LU71 (slide number: LUQ08 I 341)
;
paratypes : 14 males , 10 females LU72â€“79
( LUQ08 I 342â€“5, LUQ08 II 384, LUQ08 III 402â€“3 )
.
Intertidal muddy sediment at Qingdao coast of the Yellow Sea: 36Â°4â€² N , 120Â°19â€² E .

This species is named for the country of the type locality, China
.

The measurements are given in Table 3 . Holotype , one male : 136 M 748 850 Âµm; a = 35.4, b = 6.3, c = 8.3, spic = 30, 20, 23, 24, 23. Paratype : 148 V 744 880 Âµm; a = 24.4, b = 5.9, c = 6.5, V% = 45% 21, 30, 36, 24.

Males. Body is slender, blunt at the anterior end and attenuating at the tail end ( Figure 5C ); 839â€“933 Âµm in length and 24 Âµm in maximum diameter. Cuticle is homogeneously annulate with transverse rows of punctations, and anterior one or two transverse rows consist of small punctations. There are four longitudinal rows of dots as lateral differentiations that extend from the anterior to the posterior end. The inner two longitudinal rows of dots are thick, and the distance between these dots is about 5 Âµm at the cervical region and 3 Âµm at the rest of the body. Somatic setae are sparse and short.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 5.
Dichromadora sinica
sp. nov. (A) lateral view of male anterior end, showing buccal cavity, teeth, cephalic setae, lateral punctuation, double bulb and ventral gland cell; (B) lateral view of male tail end, showing spicule, gubernaculum and four precloacal supplements (C) lateral view of female body, showing vulva and ovary.

Figure 6.
Dichromadora sinica
sp. nov. (A) lateral view of male anterior end, showing buccal cavity, cephalic setae and lateral punctuation; (B) lateral view of male anterior end, showing double bulb; (C) lateral view of male tail end, showing spicule, gubernaculum and precloacal supplements; (D) lateral view of male tail end, showing spicule and and double-jointed postcloacal papillae.

Table 3. Individual measurements (and average) of
Dichromadora sinica
sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Tail is 80 Âµm (3.7 a.b.d.) long, conico-cylindrical with a clear spinneret. Three caudal glands are located close to the anterior end of tail.

Females. Similar to males. The reproductive system is amphidelphic with reflexed ovaries, anterior branch located to the right of the intestine and posterior branch is to the left of it. The vulva is simple, at 47% of body length from the anterior end.

Dichromadora sinica
sp. nov. is characterized by long cephalic setae, presence of clearly anterior pharyngeal bulb and well-developed posterior double bulb, four longitudinal files of dots, spicules with distal hook, four (3 + 1) precloacal supplements and paired subventral double-jointed postcloacal papillae in males. The species is similar to
D. quadripapillata
Muthumbi and Vincx, 1998
in the character of lateral differentiation and it also resembles
D. loisae Muthumbi and Vincx, 1998
, in double pharyngeal bulb. The species differs from the latter two species in the length of cephalic setae, the number and arrangement (3 + 1) of the precloacal supplements, and the presence of double-jointed postcloacal papillae in males.
